tonegod.gui.core

Class Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.scene.Spatial
      • com.jme3.scene.Node
        • tonegod.gui.core.Element
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme3.asset.CloneableSmartAsset, com.jme3.collision.Collidable, com.jme3.export.Savable, com.jme3.util.clone.JmeCloneable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimLayer, Button, DragElement, Indicator, Joystick, Label, ModalBackground, OSRViewPort, Panel, ScrollArea, ScrollPanel, ScrollPanel.ScrollPanelBounds, ScrollPanelBarH, ScrollPanelBarV, SelectListEditor, SlideTray, SpriteElement, TabControl, Table.TableCell, Table.TableRow, TextElement, TextField, VScrollBar, Window, WindowExt

    public class Element
extends com.jme3.scene.Node
    The Element class is the primitive in which all controls in the GUI portion or the library are built upon. Unlink the overloaded common constructor(s) you will find throughout the library, the library, there is a single verbose constructor:
    See Also:
    Element is backed by a 9-patch style Mesh and can be both movable and resizable by simply flagging them as such. There is no need to add Listeners to leverage this default behavior. See both:, setIsMovable(boolean), setIsResizable(boolean)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Element

        public Element(ElementManager screen,
               java.lang.String UID,
               com.jme3.math.Vector2f position,
               com.jme3.math.Vector2f dimensions,
               com.jme3.math.Vector4f resizeBorders,
               java.lang.String texturePath)
        The Element class is the single primitive for all controls in the gui library. Each element consists of an ElementQuadMesh for rendering resizable textures, as well as a BitmapText element if setText(String text) is called. Behaviors, such as movement and resizing, are common to all elements and can be enabled/disabled to ensure the element reacts to user input as needed.
        Parameters:
        screen - The Screen control the element or it's absolute parent element is being added to
        UID - A unique String identifier used when looking up elements by screen.getElementByID()
        position - A Vector2f containing the x/y coordinates (relative to it's parent elements x/y) for positioning
        dimensions - A Vector2f containing the dimensions of the element, x being width, y being height
        resizeBorders - A Vector4f containing the size of each border used for scaling images without distorting them (x = N, y = W, x = E, w = S)
        texturePath - A String path to the default image to be rendered on the element's mesh

      • setAsContainerOnly

        public void setAsContainerOnly()
        The setAsContainer only method removes the Mesh component (rendered Mesh) from the Element, leaving only Element functionality. Call this method to set the Element for use as a parent container.

      • setLocalMaterial

        public void setLocalMaterial(com.jme3.material.Material mat)
        Alter and apply the Element's default material. NOTE: It is important that the shader used with the new material is either: A: The provided Unshaded material contained with this library, or B: The custom shader contains the caret, text range, clipping and effect handling provided in the default shader.
        Parameters:
        mat - the Material to use for rendering this Element
